get.description: Retrieve a collection of Data View Categories. You can search and filter the collection using query parameters.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The collection items limit

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The collection items offset

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: List of fields you want returned separated by a coma. You can alias the returned field by adding the alias after a column

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Expand response to get full related object instead of ID. See the expand guide for more info.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The collection items sort field and order (prefix with "-" for descending sort].

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Global search for the object

parameters.name: [att]
parameters.description: Filter any attribute by its value. You can search sub-objects by using the qualified attribute name.

parameters.name: [att]:in
parameters.description: Filter the collection by attribute list.

parameters.name: [att]:contains
parameters.description: Search a specific attribute partially

parameters.name: includeInactive
parameters.description: Return the list of inactive objects in the results. By default only active objects are returned

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Custom filter that could be applied to the collection. Filter by id

parameters.name: idIn
parameters.description: Custom filter that could be applied to the collection. Filter by a list of ids, seperated by a comma.

post.description: Store a new Data View Category item.

get.description: Retrieve a Data View Category item using its unique identifier.

put.description: Edit a Data View Category item completely. To only update some attributes, use the PATCH operation.

patch.summary: Partially update a Data View Category
patch.description: Edit a Data View Category item partially by passing only the attributes you want to modify.

post.description: Unarchives the data view category

x-ttc-labels.label: Context filter for the subscription
x-ttc-labels.description:
A JSON object with two properties, `exclusions` and `filters`.
     The property `exclusions` is an array of context tags to be excluded. The property `filters` is an
     array of JSON objects, each having two properties `tag` and `includeChildren`. If no context is
     specified when creating the subscription the default one will be the region of the subscription owner
     including the sub-regions.

A JSON object with two properties, `exclusions` and `filters`.

     array of JSON objects, each having two properties `tag` and `includeChildren`. If no context is
     specified when creating the subscription the default one will be the region of the subscription owner
     including the sub-regions.

x-ttc-labels.label: Webhook endpoint URL
x-ttc-labels.description:
The webhook endpoint URL to send the event payload. Our systems will send a POST
     request with a JSON payload to this URL and expect a `2XX` response within 3 seconds. If we do not receive a
     response within 3 seconds the request will timeout and we will retry the same request up to 10 times.
     If a `2XX` response is not received after 10 retries, we will `suspend` the event subscription.
     You can re-`enable` a suspended event subscription once issues are resolved.

url.description:

x-ttc-labels.label: Secret
x-ttc-labels.description:
Keep this `secret` confidential and use it to verify the web-hook calls.
     How? Generate an HMAC(SHA512) of the request body using the `secret` as the key and compare
     it with the value of the of the request header `TrackTik-Subscription-Secret`
     or the `secretHeaderName` set when creating the subscription.
     PHP example:

     assert(hash_hmac('sha512', $requestBody, $secret) === $requestSecretHeaderValue);

collectionRequiredFilter.name: filters
collectionRequiredFilter.description:
Example of a **required filter** using the **id property**: `id:in=123,456`. 


At least one of the filters (on properties or scope) is `required`. Pseudo filters `:in` and `:between` can be used in
the filters on properties. For the properties of type *date-time* the maximum range for the `:between` pseudo filter is **1 month**.
For the pseudo filter `:in` the maximum allowed number of separated values by comma is **100**.
